title: Biofuels 2026 Outlook
content:
REPORT

						

					
							
					Markets				
						
						
			RINs Reset Lays Foundation for US Renewable Fuels Recovery
			

						Renewable identification numbers (RINs), the $28B+ engine behind US biofuel economics, are about to undergo their biggest shift since the program’s creation. With margins compressed, capacity idle, and the EPA signaling sweeping changes, the stakes for agriculture, energy and equity markets couldn’t be higher.

						
			Key report highlights:
			

						
			
The EPA’s pending 2026-27 mandates, and what could still change
How much RIN prices must rise to restart idle renewable diesel capacity
Who stands to benefit, from biomass-based diesel producers to US refiners

			

			
    
                
        
            
			Download the report now to uncover how the EPA’s 2026 reset may realign biofuel economics, domestic feedstocks, and equity exposure.

			


    			
			Enter your details for instant access
